page.title: 02Changing Face of Haddenham
page.content: Haddenham is an old Saxon village with its church recorded in the Domesday Book. Haddenham now claims to be the {largest village in England. The Enclosure Act of 1830 drastically changed village life. As trade expanded the population increased to 1545 in 1841.{The houses at this time {were mainly cottages}with a few larger houses such as{Haddenham Hall.}With the development of machinery the population slumped, until 1906 when the new railway brought some employment. After the Second World War the village expanded greatly. In 1955 many council houses were built. In the 1960s and 1970s two major estates were built. Although{it has a population of {5000}it remains a compact village with many of the older houses alongside newer properties, and no high rise developments as yet.
